headline.main: Surgeon General Warns of Smoking in Latin Lands

docs.lead_paragraph: Latin America and the Caribbean are on the verge of an epidemic of smoking-related disease like the one that has plagued the United States and Canada unless governments work to stem the popularity of cigarettes, the United States Surgeon General said today. Issuing the annual Federal report on the health effects of smoking, the Surgeon General, Dr. Antonia C. Novello, said the threat required coordinated action among all countries.
